intro: Lesliegraecum viridiflorum, commonly known as the green-flowered Lesliegraecum, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, making it a hardy addition to rock gardens. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
